relation: 3 things that will increase the HCO3 production/reabsorption
Angiotensin II stimulates the production of:
normal concentration 3.5-5 meq/L, must be maintained within its normal range or else serious complications
K <3.5 meq/L, caused by diuretics, vomiting, NG suctioning,diarrhea,liver failure, alkalosis, decreased intake and increased output, steroids, and B-agonist drugs
muscle weakness and cramps, fatigue, confusion, cardia arrhythmias, and metabolic alkalosis
causes: too rapid IV administration of K+, anything that inhibits K+ excretion (renal failure)
metabolic acidosis, muscle weakness, cardiac arrhythmias,nausea/vomit
diuretics, IV glucose and insulin (increased K+ uptake by cells, CaCl or Ca+
50% of Ca in blood is bound to protein and is affected by blood pH( increased PH=more Ca binds to protein)
renal failure, vitamin D deficiency, hyperthyroidism, dificiency in magnesium
muscle craps and weakness, tetany, arrhythmias
initiates muscular contraction, maintains neuromuscular irritability, normal blood coagulation, and maintains integrity of bones, Ca present in equal amounts ionized and nonionized
treat underlying problem, diuretics, administer phosphate
renal failure, decrease in dietary intake, GI disturbances, alcoholism
muscle craps, weakness, tetany, nausea/vomiting, arrhythmias
causes: renal failure, diabetes mellitis, adrenal insufficiency, and high magnesium diet+
diuretics, dialysis if caused by renal failure

sodium to maintain neutrality is accompanied by active transport with CL from the glomerular filtrate and into the renal tubular cell, both Na+ and Cl- are transported to the ECF and ultimately to the plasma (blood)
1) recaptures Na+2)HCO3 are reabsorbed(100% of HCO3 in tubules reabsorbed)
1. increase in PCO2 (stimulates renal compensation)2.decrease in blood volume (renin-angiotensin system)3. decrease in K+ concentration in blood
stimulates NaHCO3 reabsorption because water reabsorption follows Na+ reabsorption, blood volume increases and improves perfusion to the kidneys
can result in metabolic acidosis and hypokalemia
1. excrete daily acid load( esp. fixed acids)2. regenerate bicarb that's lost during extracellular buffering
combining with H+ ions to form NH3 which minimizes the fall in pH
used with metabolic acidosishelps diagnosing causes of met.acidosis
methanol,uremia,diabetes/diabetic ketoacidosis,propylene glycol, Inhaled drugs used to treat TB, lactic acidosis, etholyene glycol, Renal failure, salicylates
